snippet: The identities of the victims in Paris began to emerge slowly on Saturday, but families continued to struggle to find information about missing loved ones.
abstract: Victims of Paris terror attacks, many of them young people, are slowly identified as family and friends struggle to locate loved ones.

byline.contributor: Lilia Blaise and Ashley Southall contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The identities of the victims in Paris began to emerge slowly on Saturday, but families continued to struggle to find information about missing loved ones.

headline.main: Out for Fun on a Friday Night, Victims Are Mostly Young
headline.print_headline: Out for Pleasure on a Friday Night, Victims Are Mostly Young
